title: 115_hr2329
content: The Act titled "Nation Building Here at Home Act of 2017" establishes a Transformational Infrastructure Competitive Grant Program. The "Nation Building Here at Home Act of 2017" establishes a transformational infrastructure competitive grant program under which the Secretary of Transportation can make grants to state and local governments, transit agencies, and port authorities for eligible highway or bridge projects that significantly impact metropolitan areas, regions, or the United States. The "Nation Building Here at Home Act of 2017" establishes a grant program for eligible infrastructure projects, including interstate rehabilitation, rural road improvements, bridge reconstruction, seismic retrofit projects, public transportation projects, rail transportation projects, and port infrastructure investments. The "Nation Building Here at Home Act of 2017" establishes a grant program for eligible infrastructure projects, including interstate rehabilitation, rural road improvements, bridge reconstruction, seismic retrofit projects, public transportation projects, rail transportation projects, and port infrastructure investments. The Secretary shall coordinate any grant for a water infrastructure project with the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency and the Secretary of the Army. Entities must submit an application to the Secretary to be eligible for a grant under the program. The Secretary will issue regulations for grant awards based on specified criteria, including financial commitments from non-Federal sources. The Federal share of project costs will be determined. The Federal share of project costs for grants under subsection (b) cannot exceed 100 percent. Grants must be distributed equitably, address urban and rural needs, promote veteran employment, and support small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals. The project grants must comply with Title 40 requirements and Buy America provisions, ensuring that all iron, steel, and goods used are made in the USA. The Buy America provisions allow for waivers if applying them goes against the public interest, if the required goods are not produced in the USA, or if using American products increases project costs by over 25%. The Secretary must provide a detailed justification for any waivers granted. This subsection must align with US international agreements. The Secretary must ensure transparency and accountability in the grant program, including expeditious use of funds, public availability of grant information, and reporting to Congress on grant progress. Environmental streamlining coordination with relevant federal departments is also required. Authorization of Appropriations: The Secretary is authorized to appropriate $1,263,000,000,000 for grants under the program from 2018 to 2022. 85% of the funds will be used for projects in subsection (c)(1)(A), (B), or (C), while 2% will be allocated for projects in subsection (c)(1)(D). Authorization of Appropriations: 4% of the funds will be used for projects in subparagraph (D) of subsection (c)(1), 4% for projects in subparagraph (E), and 9% for projects in subparagraph (F). The Nation Building Here at Home Financing Initiative is outlined in Section 3. The Secretary of the Treasury, in consultation with the Secretary of Transportation, will establish a Nation Building Here at Home Financing Initiative within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The Treasury Secretary may issue bonds up to $300 billion, with specific terms and conditions. Proceeds from these bonds will be provided to the Secretary of Transportation. The Secretary of Transportation may use proceeds from bonds issued under subsection (b) to carry out the program established under section 2(a) of this Act. The Secretary of Transportation must submit a report to Congress within 180 days of this Act's enactment, detailing the transportation needs of the United States for the next 20, 30, and 50 years.
